review: Fire Stick does a great job how I expected it to perform for Plex, Netflix, and Hulu. However, it does not support some audio modes for Plex (AAC 5.1). Also, the main reason for 4 out of 5 stars is that it sticks Amazon Prime videos down your throat. I don't want or have Amazon Prime so give me an option to hide or re-arrange my menu and it would be all good. The way it is, I have to click too many times to get through the Prime clutter to get to my apps that I want to use.

review: I bought one for myself and one for my parents, since we both love our Roku's and wanted a second one for the bedroom tv. What a mistake! It constantly loses internet connectivity (I do have it plugged in to power as it recommends) and buffers for five minutes then plays for 1. I'd blame my internet, except said Roku works fine. What a disappointment.
author: L.Willson

review: What one gets for the price makes it a great purchase.  I love the fact it comes with a remote.  I received the product when promised and it was very easy to set up and begin using.  Over the course of about 2 or 3 weeks however the remote would seem to stick.  It got to where when I tried to scroll up, down, left, or right to make selections the scrolling would not stop until it went as far in one direction as possible...can't just scroll 1 item as a time. Before this issue the device was a dream to have.
author: Vincent Lancaster

review: Do not buy.I don't normally leave reviews (although appreciate those who do) but this product is pointless. It can not keep network connectivity at all. I have no issue with other devices at home, but this streams for a couple minutes and then freezes or buffers. I have now read multiple reviews with the same comments but not anything from amazon on how to rectify. The box might be better to correct direct but the stick is not a good purchase if you want to stream off wifi. Boo amazon.
author: Jesseca L. Marchand

review: I usually use by blue ray player to connect to netflix, amazon prime etc.  The fire stick is quicker access, but the menu is not user friendly and I find myself going back and starting over when I can't find what I am looking for.
